website_summaries.verdict: The best budget rebounder to buy when you want a good return surface that will last a long time.
pros: Steel frame is adjustable to provide multiple return angles on-the-fly
Curved angle varies the return trajectory for a more effective practice
Frame folds inward for easy storage when not in use
cons: All-steel frame can feel more flimsy than more heavy-duty options

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For Lacrosse Practice
customer_reviews.text: I bought this primarily for practicing lacrosse with my son. I couldn't be any happier with it. The return angles are perfect... everything from pop-flys to ground balls, even without having to adjust the back legs. Lacrosse balls are heavier than baseballs, so I know it'll work great for baseball too. Between the price and performance of this piece of equipment, I'm completely satisfied. Money well spent. Update - After 2 years of use/ownership enough of the bungee straps have broken and I'm back in the market for another one. I'm not deducting any stars from my review, because I have left it outside during the entire 2 years, exposed to every weather condition possible.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy F.

customer_reviews.title: Well Built, Great & FUN teaching tool for young baseball fanatics!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my baseball crazy nephew to use while he is at my house. We keep this outside in the weather year-round and it still looks like it is brand new. The construction is very durable...if it can stand up to the abuse my nephew gives it, then it will stand up to anything! He loves playing with this...making up games to incorporate the flyback net into even if multiple people are playing with him. It has also helped with teaching him about hitting/strike zone, control and accuracy of his throwing, playing unpredictable bounces when catching and so on. Many ways to use this to teach baseball but also have fun at the same time!
customer_reviews.author: HockeyCoachBen

customer_reviews.title: Terrible bungee holders
customer_reviews.text: This works as described for about 1 month. After the first month, 2 of the holders came off. In the second month, 3 more have broke off. We have had this put together for 2 months and 1 week and have 6 of the bungee holders broke. We have only ever used baseball's on this with 2 small children under the age of 9. I would imagine it would be worse with soccerballs, etc. I would look for something else before buying this otem! Sad this ball return probably won't even make it 6 months!
customer_reviews.author: hp22

customer_reviews.title: I previously owned a less expensive pitchback and this one is MUCH better. Throw to the bottom of the net to ...
customer_reviews.text: I use it for baseball only. It works well. I previously owned a less expensive pitchback and this one is MUCH better. Throw to the bottom of the net to practice fielding popups. Throw high into the net for grounders. Pretty good quality, too! The only negative is that this one is so big I can't carry it inside to protect it during rains. I'm not sure how well it will last being stored outside all the time.
customer_reviews.author: x

customer_reviews.title: Best indoor quarantine practice buy
customer_reviews.text: Son loves it during this quarantine time. He uses it with lite flite balls from Jugs, and gets some work in while it is raining outside. Hopefully the rain will let up soon to see how really baseballs do. Easy to put together. The net was a little harder. Needed to muscle a lot of the bungie's into place. Fingers hurt pretty bad afterwards, but that's about it. 10 year old can adjust by himself and over the last 3 days has put about 4 hours of work into it. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Wannabedyi

customer_reviews.title: Overall decent inexpensive..but...
customer_reviews.text: Generally works, I am an adult who hasn’t thrown for 40 yrs due to past injury. Now, my shoulder is fine. This is not too hard to assemble, directions could be improved, I am mechanically inclined, ended up looking at the picture to get the legs and net fastened. One thing about this, the pins to hold the back legs, they are essentially useless, best to find replacements that will stay in the holes during a tossing session. The stakes are pretty useless, they also come out of the ground since they are too short and too thin, these also need replaced. They function to a point, maybe for kids..overall product worth the money but can use improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Biggs

customer_reviews.title: This Flyback is a well built item and will provide hours of enjoyment to the baseball player in your life.
customer_reviews.text: I had a pitch back in my youth, not as elaborate as this one, but I enjoyed hours of fun with it. I bought this one for my grandson and he and his sister use it daily. You can actually have two players use it at the same time, alternating throwing and catching. I opened the box and made sure that all the pieces were sent. I found no issues with the quality of this product and no parts were missing. The only difficult assembly part was installing the net bungee cords on the sides of the frame. You have to stretch them further than the others to connect them. I would suggest buying this Flyback to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Rob from Phoenix

customer_reviews.title: Wrong and damaged parts
customer_reviews.text: Will update when I get the new one. Sat down yesterday to put this together. Part 4 was identical to 5. I shouldn't be. Pin needs to be on other side. Thought I was wrong, had my dad and nephew look at it too and they agree. So I figured, let me keep going, maybe I'll duct tape it. My son and nephew wanted to play. Then I found part of the black piece was broken. Still kept going. Opened the net, which was in an air-sealed bag and found one section blackened (as if burned) AND frayed. Another section had some black wire around and through it. Needless to say, I'm incredibly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Hastings

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great addition to our yard for our baseball-loving 9yo. We had another version last summer, but it didn't hold up well at all. This one is very well made and I like that the back legs come up for easier storage. The net seems to be made very well and the fasteners that hold it on are very substantial. Assembly was easily done with help from one of our kids. I would definitely recommend this to someone with a kid that loves to practice pitching and throwing.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Really Cheap Product
customer_reviews.text: This thing was easy to put together right up to the point where you needed to put in the cotter pins to adjust the angle of the net. I've never been able to get the cotter pin on the left side to fit through the hole and so it just hangs free. I even took it apart and reassembled it. The net feels strong with the tension and it feels like it would at least hold up for one or two seasons. However, I don't like it when products don't fit/assemble correctly and you have to jerry-rig something to get it to work when it's brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old loves this pitch back! As part of the electronic generation, my children tend to tire of toys very quickly. We're about three weeks into having this set up and he still gets off the bus and goes straight to it almost every day. It has made a noticeable improvement in his game. He's finally put an end to his side-arm experiment and has become much more accurate with his pitching. The unit is sturdy and was super easy to assemble. Definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: MayberryInTheCity

customer_reviews.title: He was so happy to get this and used it all summer
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 10 year old nephew. He loves baseball, but doesn't have anyone to play catch with at home. He was so happy to get this and used it all summer. He works hard won the MVP award in his little league. This product held up to his standards
customer_reviews.author: Desiree

customer_reviews.title: Black Strike  Zone Strip breaks immediately.
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loved this, but the black strike zone strip fell apart immediately! I did write the manufacturer, and they give you a phone number to call that has a message "sorry due to high volume of calls, call back" no answer ever! You can't even purchase a replacement. However, since it falls apart immediately who would want to buy a replacement. They need to change their product. Hope this review helps. The ball return does work good.
customer_reviews.author: matilda

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts and no instructions
customer_reviews.text: This came with no instructions, and it was missing a screw that was long enough for me to hold it all together. They literally sent me two different size screws and I had to go into my personal stash and replace the screw. Aside from that it’s a really good piece of equipment, my son loves it and I figured out how to put it together on my own without any instruction so it’s not too hard to assemble even without them.
customer_reviews.author: dabs

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up, does exactly the job it should!
customer_reviews.text: Just inboxed and assembled it... 15 minutes to assemble. Pretty easy. For the price, it is a nice pitch back. My kids needed something for the back yard to work on their throwing and grounding... this will definitely do the trick. I’ve read some reviews stating people have broken the plastic clips on the bungees. Important tip!!! - Twist the bungees so the plastic knobs are in the BACK so they don’t get hit by a ball. The ground spikes are thin but seem to be holding just fine. All in all, seems good so far. I will update in the future if any problems arise!
customer_reviews.author: Scott R. Schaecher

customer_reviews.title: Decent Purchase
customer_reviews.text: This was purchase for my 8 year old son, who loves it! We have had it for a few months and he has used it often and it is holding up well. The only downfalls is once assembled, it is large. Storing it has been a little tricky, but we sort of new this going in. Second, it is not easy to assemble. The net was a bit of a pain to put on and you will need another person to help. The directions are not super clear also. We had to read reviews to understand how to assemble it. Otherwise, we are happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Parts do NOT match up
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this product! I ordered from Franklin sports because I have ordered other things and have been happy. However, the pieces were poorly made and the holes do NOT match up for the back black pieces that helps the structure stand and move the net up and down to change the angles. I have contacted the company to ask for replacement parts so will update if they follow through. We currently can't even use this item because the holes were not drilled properly and they will not align. Would NOT recommend this product currently.
customer_reviews.author: Cherie Hocanson

customer_reviews.title: Just some quirks, but overall good buy
customer_reviews.text: Overall, it’s pretty good. It does what it’s supposed to do. It wasn’t easy to get the net on though. The assembly was a breeze until that point. I had to take it off and assemble like trampoline springs- you do a few on each side and build up from there. Also, the ribbon you weave in to show where to throw is not well made and awkward to put on. Again, overall is good. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: C.F.

customer_reviews.title: As expected-Satisfied customer
customer_reviews.text: Purchased on a Monday night around 10 EST, arrived Wednesday by 11:00am. Packaging was good and was in an undisclosed plain cardboard box, which was good as it was a bday gift and the receipt (child) was home. All correct items were in the package. I was concerned about the netting as some reviews stated their's was too small. I was nervous at first because it looked small, however as we stretched the net (can be difficult) the net fits just fine. The bungee cords can be rough on your fingers, but that's expected with how it's suppose to be put together. Works just as described. Happy birthday kiddo~happy parents!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Great Softball Trainer
customer_reviews.text: Daughter plays select softball and this trainer has been perfect for practicing pitching when she is on her own without a catcher. Gives her the flexibility to practice on her own when she has extra time. She also uses it for working on catching grounders and just throwing and catching. Great product for a kid to work on their craft on their own.
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: Rebounder
customer_reviews.text: The product works as expected and the kids enjoy it. Assembly is OK. I always think the nets for these are smaller than they should be, which makes assembly a challenge. The biggest issue in the assembly is the height adjuster. That is just a bad design. It would be better to fix the height because the adjustment feature was poorly designed.
customer_reviews.author: Bargain Shopper

customer_reviews.title: So so quality, but does work fine.
customer_reviews.text: As a fun thing to do with the kids to teach fundamentals it works great. Resistance bands took some effort during install. Locking pins don’t stay in place and the thing falls down or moves. Lastly, the frame bends and dents if you hit it with a ball. They should have better pins, and the frame should be a bit more durable.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for child learning to play ball!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as expected. Our child loved it. It is great for helping him work on his catching skills. It is very light so easy to move. I wouldn't leave it outside for extended periods though.
customer_reviews.author: bejoyfulalways

customer_reviews.title: Great pitchback net for the money
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, my 12 yo nephew put it together but had to have help putting the net on. It is very tight once stretched out. I bought this to replace a cheaper pitch back net that only lasted 1 day. Well worth the money. Very sturdy, really strong net, sturdy well built frame and it is adjustable. The only complaint I have is the pins that hold the back legs in where you can adjust it are too small and fall out easy. Tractor Supply has some good replacement pins that work well. Over All it is well worth the money! Do not waste your money on cheaper nets that fall apart the first time you use them.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Newrones

customer_reviews.title: Regretting purchase...
customer_reviews.text: Have had this less than 2 months, the weld seams on the corners have come apart. This is a poor quality product, obviously they didn't test the frame when they designed this product.
customer_reviews.author: G. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: good bounce back but....
customer_reviews.text: got 2 holes in the net within a week. My 13 yr old was pitching into it and net didn't hold. Using it mainly for my 6 year old not a 13 yr old throwing 65 mph. The good thing is i contacted customer service, although it took 5 days to respond, but they sent me 2 more nets.
customer_reviews.author: cory scamman

customer_reviews.title: Pitching and Catching
customer_reviews.text: OK quality...might snap a finger or two with a bungie cord plastic fastener from Hell during construction, but I love the thing. Brought me back to the good ol' days of being a kid with no responsibility, a little sun, and hours throwing into one of these. Now if it only came with a game controller, I could get my kid out there without his head hanging and me yelling.
customer_reviews.author: SE

customer_reviews.title: My 8 year old grandson loves this - says it really helps him with pitching, throwing & catching!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 8 year old grandson so he could practice pitching & throwing & catching on his own at home. I didn’t actually assemble it so not sure how easily it went together. He is thrilled with it tho, which is the most important aspect to me.
customer_reviews.author: Luce

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: My 8yr old bought this and was so excited to practice with it. Played with it 2x before the net broke. Putting the frame together was a breeze, but attaching the net was almost impossible. Finally got the net stretched enough. My son play with it the same night for about an hour. The next day he went to play with it and one of the pins that hold the position kept falling out and the net broke where one of the bungees held it to the frame.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy

customer_reviews.title: One Happy Grandson
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our grandson's birthday and was it ever a hit! We are so happy he loves it! It sends the ball right back to him like it's supposed to! His pitch is improving and catching the ball consistently is too. The only thing wrong with it is that it keeps the dog from playing catch as much.
customer_reviews.author: confused in Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Basic flaw in design.
customer_reviews.text: Everything works well on this piece of equipment except one critical piece. The pin that holds the back legs on comes out with minimal impact. There is no way to lock it in. Therefore, you have to constantly stop and re-insert pin. I would not buy knowing what I know now.
customer_reviews.author: Roger B.

customer_reviews.title: Broken net out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Broken net right out of the box. This is useless before ever being used. And it’s past the return deadline since I waited until today (my kid’s birthday) to set it up and surprise him. Total waste of time and money!
customer_reviews.author: Frizz

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to get my arm in shape for softball, but it broke the first day. I wasn’t even throwing that hard or that far. It was a pain in the you know. I wouldn’t suggest this, nor would I buy it again. Huge disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Justme

customer_reviews.title: Meh! Does what it does..
customer_reviews.text: You pay for what you get. It will do the job, but don’t plan on hitting or throwing hard into it. We had multiple missing parts and had to contact manufacturer. Manufacturer was great and sent parts out but was another week to week and half before parts arrived. It must be weighed down or will move. It also just simply isn’t a sturdy one. But for the price was good, I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Richie

customer_reviews.title: Net failure
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to my son today for Christmas and when putting the bungee cord on the top net tore. The frame seems very sturdy though.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn E. Rudie

customer_reviews.title: Net Broke after a few pitches
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old son threw a few dozen harballs and it worked well. Unfortunately the net broke in one place at the perimeter where the net attaches to the frame. I can't imaging this will last more that a few weeks with such flimsy net material.
customer_reviews.author: KEN

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Have loved tossing tennis balls against the house and catching them in my mit since I was a kid, then got this and even better. Can use a baseball, practice my pitching, and create any type of angle I want for the ball based on where I throw it and/or how I angle the device. Nice product and great price.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew A. Mckean

customer_reviews.title: We just set this up in our backyard and the ...
customer_reviews.text: We just set this up in our backyard and the string right in the strike zone snapped within the first 20 min. We sort of tied it together but it's not going to hold. We have had quite a few pitch backs over the years and clearly this one is defective. I am hoping that Franklin will send us a new one or new yet. Will update after I've heard from them.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds our expectations.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for exercise and fun - everyone who visits enjoys the challenge (how many catches without missing) and it's a great workout for the arms and for eye-hand coordination. We are very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Avant

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son so he could get the hang of throwing and catching, without always needing someone to play with. The assembly was easy for the most part. Getting the net into place is slight challenge, but you want the net to be super tight, so thats just how it is. Easy to put the rest of the parts on, stake into the ground, and to use. Easy to move around the yard as well.
customer_reviews.author: Bertie_16

customer_reviews.title: Not a toy...a real piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was not complex but was challenging...mounting the net in particular. Works great and should stand up to even the fastest pitcher. Also works well for little kids. Read the specs carefully this thing is big!
customer_reviews.author: J. Friedman

customer_reviews.title: Batter up!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandsons ages 8-9. The Flyback is sturdy and allows me to coach while I'm standing beside them. Make certain to purchase a bucket of balls! The spikes to used to support the unit are useful only on grass, but the balls ABSOLUTELY "Flyback" when thrown into the net. It's really good for solitary throwing practice.
customer_reviews.author: Dazed

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Flyback Return
customer_reviews.text: I got this last year for my granddaughter for Christmas. She's a girly girl, but also really into sports. She LOVES it. It's nice when they still play with what you got them last year. :-).
customer_reviews.author: CINDY PFEFFER

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: BEWARE!! SENT WITH MISSING PARTS!! Bought this for my son to practice throwing and catching prior to a big game. Went to assemble it, and a part was missing! The assembly instructions are somewhat clear, but one of the sections was missing. Have yet to be able to get through to customer support to get a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: IsieP

customer_reviews.title: No bounce
customer_reviews.text: The net stretches too far for the bungee cords to give the net any bounce so it doesn't throw the ball back very well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nylon snapped on first pitch
customer_reviews.text: One throw at the net and the nylon snapped. Another spot looked like it is going to snap. We had one of the same previously pitch backs that lasted over a year. Disappointed with the netting this time.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Otten

customer_reviews.title: My son likes it
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my son and he likes it. It’s still holding up after 3 months of practice and so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Markyman

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality - not durable
customer_reviews.text: When it worked, it worked great for my 12 year old son. After about 2 weeks, the support bars holding the net and frame bent where they attach to the frame and the item is now unusable. This is the second Franklin Sports rebound product that I've purchased from Amazon where the frame has bent. Very disappointed overall.
customer_reviews.author: busymummy

customer_reviews.title: Rips in net upon arrival.
customer_reviews.text: I'm super disappointed. This product took almost a month to get to me and I put the entire item together only to find the net has rips in it. No quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Derek M

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up, good quality. Haven't had any issues yet. We have not had to stake it down yet either, although my little guy is only 8, we'll probably get to staking it down eventually. I have been very impressed with the quality and the ease of this product. I would definitely recommend it if you're looking for quality!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Sadler

customer_reviews.title: Great design - low quality net
customer_reviews.text: After 10 mins of play by a 6 and 4 year old, one of the squares on the outside of the net came apart. Other squares are close to coming apart as well. The net is not of high quality at all. The design of the product is great - the 6 year old was able to practice pop flies, grounders and just plain throwing and catching. He’s thrilled with it.
customer_reviews.author: Mia

customer_reviews.title: Love the curved design!
customer_reviews.text: My son has used this for a couple of months now. It went together easily, and works as advertised. We really like how it can be used for ground balls fly balls and in between.
customer_reviews.author: Jens Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I got this for 7 year grandson to practice. He uses it every day. Seems to be holding up nicely. I wouldn't leave out in weather, the net will lose its "snap".
customer_reviews.author: Julie Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: A fun tool for practicing throwing and catching
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my six year old son to practice throwing and catching. He loves it, and I’ve been really impressed with it too. Does exactly what it’s meant to. The curve in it means the baseball get returned differently depending on where you hit it with the ball, which is great for practicing aim and fielding different types of balls.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Stout

customer_reviews.title: broke already after a few uses
customer_reviews.text: broke after a few uses.... the plastic holding the legs together broke, then the elastic band holding net broke
customer_reviews.author: padronanniversary

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: After my son and I assembled this, we didn’t expect it to have much spring. Preparing for disappointment, my son took the first throw and threw it kind of hard, thinking it would require a lot of force for the ball to bounce all the way back. The ball rebounded at light speed and clocked him right in the face. I fell on the ground laughing. Luckily it was a tennis ball!
customer_reviews.author: David Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Big, sturdy and red
customer_reviews.text: I do not remember this thing being so big or sturdy as a child. This will last for a while and help with throwing skills
customer_reviews.author: YOU

customer_reviews.title: Durability
customer_reviews.text: A very pleasant surprise. Sturdy and has been a great tool for individual skills development.
customer_reviews.author: Hal Mcbride

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: My boys are loving this! It took two people to set the net up because it has to be extremely tight. Other than that, set up was fairly easy. My 2 and 9 year old use it and it’s worked out so far.
customer_reviews.author: jessicake3

customer_reviews.title: Very well made and easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and easy to assemble, not painted but powder coated. Was using it within 30 minutes of arrival. At almost 70 years old my hand and eye coordination has improved greatly within the last two weeks. NOW I can stand 20 feet away, hit my target and have it return the ball to me!
customer_reviews.author: Phu Cat

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Came earlier than initial delivery time. Easy to install. I like the size for my son, he is 8. Great bounce back from the net. The black ribbon that you weave in and out to make square could have more Velcro in end so it stays together better.
customer_reviews.author: Rock Muzic

customer_reviews.title: missing key pieces
customer_reviews.text: product did not come with all the pieces needed. this had been a common problem for those who order this product. better to go to sports store.
customer_reviews.author: ezseattle

customer_reviews.title: Its ok, the pins do not line up, ...
customer_reviews.text: Its ok, the pins do not line up, we had to use a hammer to get them in, and then some how they were able to work themselves back out lol
customer_reviews.author: Markwood, Chris

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for backyard
customer_reviews.text: Great for throwing and rebounding drills. And just backyard fun. Plenty sturdy and light enough to move out of the way for lawn mowing!
customer_reviews.author: Rubens the Robot

customer_reviews.title: Girls love it, too.
customer_reviews.text: really liked this for my granddaughter. She is an only child and this makes it easy for her to play catch on her own.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Smith

customer_reviews.title: Easy to move around
customer_reviews.text: This is wonderful! My daughters can practice now without someone else throwing the ball. Flyballs, grounders, and surprises. They can even practice pitching. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: seems more sturdy than our last pitch back
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived with incorrect pole. Not able to put together and use, seems more sturdy than our last pitch back. waiting on replacement we will see if that one is right.
customer_reviews.author: John Schultz

customer_reviews.title: My son and his friend put this together - they are 11
customer_reviews.text: My son bought it with his birthday gift card. He loves it. Seems to be holding strong.
customer_reviews.author: D. Todd

customer_reviews.title: Broken strings to secure to frame
customer_reviews.text: Opened up box to assemble got the frame put together. Started installing the net and found that it had alot of broken strings where you secured it around the frame, also it didnt come with the red tape for the strike zone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my 6 year old to practice his throwing.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda L.

customer_reviews.title: Good baseball net
customer_reviews.text: Grandsons love to use this when throwing baseballs in the back yard.
customer_reviews.author: American Patriot

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly easy to assemble. The net was easily marked for assembly. Seems relatively sturdy but not the best quality I've seen. For the price, the quality met my expectations
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for grandson
customer_reviews.text: Works just as advertised. Great for practice in the backyard.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Leiter

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I didn't think it would hold up as well as it did, never toppled over hooks to keep secure to ground were useless, need something better, but with out the hooks in place I never had a problem having the re-bounder staying stationary.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: Meh’
customer_reviews.text: Would have given 3 stars. However, on assembly, one of the bungee cords completely snapped and shot the anchor device somewhere into the abyss of my lawn. I managed to rig it to function as it should. Overall, it serves its purpose. Would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to assemble and it works as expected. It is very fun for my kids and I to play with.
customer_reviews.author: MJL

customer_reviews.title: Net was torn when we received it but husband was able to work with it and our grandchildren love it!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! The net was torn when we got it but my husband made it work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Young and old enjoyed it. The unit did not take long to ...
customer_reviews.text: Young and old enjoyed it. The unit did not take long to assemble and it appears to be sturdy. It was great because there was no need to chase after the ball. Bought 2.... one for each daughter so my grandchildren can play.
customer_reviews.author: G. Gatto

customer_reviews.title: Defective or incomplete
customer_reviews.text: The black support pieces are not long enough to connect/adjust to the red pieces. Franklin needs some quality control : (
customer_reviews.author: Ly

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: My daughter wants to use it for her volleyball practice. It works perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Vladimir Sheinfeld

customer_reviews.title: Not as described.
customer_reviews.text: The description of this is deceiving I believe. This was my boy’s big gift for Christmas, and as Santa went to go assemble it, he realized all of the poles were missing. The only thing included was the net and it’s hooks. Sending it back for a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Katelyn Pilley

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: My parents got me this and it is an excellent product . I have had it for about 4 years now and I definitely recommend it. My Dad ran it over with the lawnmower and I used it for 2 years after that . Plus it's one of the most affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Frame very easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Frame very easy to put together. Would suggest two people to install the net because it is very difficult to stretch the net and attach bungees by yourself. Changing positions is also difficult. The holes do not line up correctly. Very hard to get the pin in/out of hole when changing positions. Over all, not a bad product for my 6 y.o.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves it. Much better quality then previous one we owned. Highly Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: I use this for volleyball. I use on concrete, grass and sand. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: @Erika317

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: I put this together in about 10 minutes for my daughter. It works well for rebounding.
customer_reviews.author: Klobie82

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together, all the parts there, holding up well so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Good practice for son and a fun diversion for dad too
customer_reviews.text: Does the job it was designed to do. Was missing one connector pin but a call to franklin and they mailed a replacement out.
customer_reviews.author: energy_tone

customer_reviews.title: Needs elastic demarcation for center
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Performs as expected, however, the material used to make the center square is not durable and it breaks into pieces--needs elasticity in the material for the center square.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super for our Grandson
customer_reviews.text: This return trainer is perfect for my grandson. It was easy to assemble and it stores easily.
customer_reviews.author: Mike S

customer_reviews.title: Great for 7 year old
customer_reviews.text: Great ball return. My 7 year old loves it. The metal pins that hold it up at different heights has a stopper that falls off a lot, so we ended up replacing it with a longer bolt and nut. Overall, works for our backyard purposes.
customer_reviews.author: CAtoCHI

customer_reviews.title: Defective part
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was a breeze until one defective part derailed the whole thing. Had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Tpel

customer_reviews.title: and my 8-year-old and 13-year-old boys love it.
customer_reviews.text: Even though I knew the dimensions, it was bigger than I had pictured in my mind, and my 8-year-old and 13-year-old boys love it.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Not great but probably works for a season or two - once you get it assembled
customer_reviews.text: The manual works for most parts but some areas are terrible to decipher. Multiple components were bent and did not go together without having to bent them back myself. I am also not convinced that it will last long (mostly referring to the net).
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Hard to assemble/very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Straps/clips to hold net to frame was very hard to get together. Pitching square box adheres very chintzy- falls off almost immediately. Strong frame and sting net and pitches back.
customer_reviews.author: DesignTinker

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Would give 5 stars, but came without the ribbon needed to create strike zone.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Davies

customer_reviews.title: Easy to mount and work very well
customer_reviews.text: I purchse this multi position ball return trainer for my grand daugther whos 10 yo ... and she love it !!!
customer_reviews.author: Pierre Cartier

customer_reviews.title: Better than I thought
customer_reviews.text: Better than I thought. Easy for one person to assemble, just need a bit of finger strength...let the bungies do the hard work. Sat in the rain and still works great.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy M&M

customer_reviews.title: Not so good.
customer_reviews.text: One of the legs is damaged - will not connect properly (metal tab will not push out through the leg to connect through the other leg). I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Schulte

customer_reviews.title: My son uses it all the time and loves it ...
customer_reviews.text: My son uses it all the time and loves it. Have had for more than 6 months. Not sure how it holds up outside since it has only been used in the basement.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer M

product_meta.title: Franklin Sports Pitch Back Baseball Rebounder - Pitch Return Trainer and Rebound Net - All Angles for Grounders and Pop Flies
product_meta.description:
Perfect for fielding practice, this baseball training net allows kids and adults to tackle challenging pop flies, ground balls, and everything in between at all the right angles. From practicing baseball to softball, no other baseball trainer offers such a reliable pitching net and steel frame for the highest dependability and rugged use, day after day.

Now, kids can practice with a baseball pitch return that allows them to independently hone their skills. This all-weather baseball rebounder net offers more effective field training than a pitching machine, while still allowing for consistent practice and improvement. Available in two sizes, 68 x 48 and 68 x 44, this baseball return trainer can easily fit in a backyard, on a patio, or in any open space.

Improve catching skills with a baseball throw net that allows for pitch-back practice. Don’t waste time with an inferior baseball training net that warps or tears. See why the Franklin return trainer offers the best value and highest quality!
feature_bullets: ALL-WEATHER NET: Neither spring rains nor summer heat will shred or tear the durable all-weather netting of this baseball trainer. Practice return baseball skills with ease and greater accuracy with a pitchback net that lasts

UNIQUE CURVED DESIGN: Help your child practice field techniques without needing someone else to hit pop-ups or grounders. Help kids learn proper fielding quickly while giving them the freedom to spend hours outside with this baseball trainer

ADJUSTABLE ANGLES: The curved, adjustable legs allow for maximum return angles for improved practice and field performance. Why invest hundreds in a pitching machine when you can get more value with the Franklin return trainer?

DURABLE STEEL FRAME: Although this baseball training net is designed for all types of weather, you can fold up the durable steel frame for easy storage when not in use. Enjoy years of reliable practice with this pitching net

PRACTICE FIELDING TECHNIQUES: Kids and adults alike will enjoy using this sturdy, solid, and reliable flyback net. In addition to its steel frame, it also comes with stakes for greater stability, throw after throw
